title: Heavy Duty Combined Cleaning (sifter) Integrated Flour mill Machine EPC provider: www.immy.cn

tasks.task: Driving a vehicle to reach the farm location.
subtasks: Inserting the key into the ignition.
Rotating the key to start the vehicle.
Pressing the accelerator pedal to move the vehicle.
Using the steering wheel to navigate the vehicle.

tasks.task: Guiding a tractor equipped with a plow.
subtasks: Sitting in the tractor seat.
Gripping the steering wheel to turn the plow into position.
Applying foot pressure to the clutch.
Using the hand throttle to adjust engine speed.
Operating the pedals to engage or disengage the plow.

tasks.task: Utilizing a power post-hole digger to bury fence posts.
subtasks: Getting into position with the digger.
Inserting the digger jaws into the ground.
Pressing the foot pedal to power the digging.
Rotating the digger head to dig around the post.
Removing the excavated soil.
Aligning the post with the dug hole.
Lowering the post into the hole.
Backfilling the hole with soil or other material.

tasks.task: Handling livestock by loading them into a trailer.
subtasks: Approaching the trailer and livestock.
Ensuring safety measures are in place.
Using a lead rope or stick to guide a horse onto the trailer.
Securing the animal in a position on the trailer.
Repeat for multiple animals as necessary.

tasks.task: Operating a skid-steer loader to stack hay bales.
subtasks: Mounting the skid-steer loader.
Observing the environment for potential hazards.
Navigating the loader to reach hay storage area.
Using the forks or bucket to lift hay bales.
Transporting bales to the stack location.
Carefully placing each bale onto the stack without causing it to collapse.

tasks.task: Applying pesticide to crops using a sprayer.
subtasks: Positioning the sprayer correctly in the field.
Climbing onto or into the sprayer to begin operation.
Adjusting the spray nozzles or settings.
Moving the sprayer through the rows while maintaining even coverage.
Monitoring the pressure and flow rate of the pesticide.

tasks.task: Harvesting crops with a combine harvester.
subtasks: Entering the combine and performing a pre-harvest check.
Starting the combine and testing its operation.
Driving the combine through the crop field.
Adjusting the cutting height or speed as needed.
Monitoring the grain tank to prevent overfilling.
Optional: Adjusting the threshing or cleaning system.

tasks.task: Applying fertilizer to crops using a spreader.
subtasks: Loading the fertilizer into the spreader.
Setting the spread pattern width or adjustment.
Following the correct speed or travel path when applying.
Checking the distribution to ensure even coverage.

tasks.task: Checking the health of livestock by examining their hides and udders.
subtasks: Gentle approach to the animal.
Visually inspecting the hide for signs of injury or disease.
Inspecting the udder for swelling, redness, or abnormalities.
Assessing overall body condition and reflexes if suitable.

tasks.task: Conducting a soil sample test by collecting a representative sample.
subtasks: Choosing an appropriate location in the field for sampling.
Using a soil probe or auger to extract a core sample.
Ensuring the sample is undisturbed and representative of the area.
Placing the sample into a container or bag for analysis.
Labeling the container with location and date information.

tasks.task: Adjusting irrigation systems to water fields properly.
subtasks: Inspecting the sprinkler or drip system for leaks or blown components.
Calculating the water pressure and flow rate needed.
Moving pivot irrigation structures to different positions in the field.
Ensuring even coverage across the irrigated areas.

tasks.task: Using a grain dryer to dry harvested crops.
subtasks: Loading grain into the dryer hopper or auger.
Setting the desired temperature and speed of drying.
Monitoring the moisture content and adjusting settings if necessary.
Controlling the direction of air flow through the equipment.

tasks.task: Installing and maintaining fencing around pasture lands.
subtasks: Selecting the appropriate type of fencing (e.g., electric, woven) based on needs.
Digging post holes and inserting posts (as covered in MAINTASK: Utilizing a power post-hole digger to bury fence posts).
Attaching wire or railings to the fence posts.
Testing the tension and security of the fence installation.

tasks.task: Removing a tree stump using a flail mower.
subtasks: Positioning the flail mower around the stump.
Operating the mower to grind the stump into chips or smaller pieces.
Clearing debris and checking if further treatment is needed (e.g., chemical application).
Inspecting machinery for wear or damage before use.
Cleaning visible dirt and debris from the equipment.
Lubricating moving parts as needed.
Checking fluids such as oil, fuel, and hydraulic fluid levels.
Tightening loose bolts or screws.
Replacing any worn components like filters or belts.

tasks.task: Planning a planting schedule based on soil and weather conditions.
subtasks: Evaluating current soil conditions (e.g., moisture, temperature).
Considering the expected weather forecast for the coming weeks.
Determining the optimal days for planting specific crops based on maturity needs.
Taking into account crop rotation and pest cycle timing.

tasks.task: Entering data into farming management software.
subtasks: Logging planting dates, quantities, and variety types.
Tracking soil tests and fertilizer application records.
Monitoring crop growth stages and yields.
Generating reports for financial management or crop disease tracking.

tasks.task: Conducting a land survey to assess the layout and topography for planting.
subtasks: Walking the fields with surveying tools like a transit or total station.
Marking benchmark points or grade contour lines.
Noting variations in elevation or soil fertility.
Creating a map or plan for optimal planting patterns.
